alert.note: Alert for St. Louis (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 5:44PM CDT until May 24 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Illinois, including the following counties, Monroe and Saint Clair. Portions of east central Missouri, including the following county and independent city, Saint Louis and Saint Louis City. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 544 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... St. Louis, East St. Louis, Arnold, Cahokia, Crestwood, Columbia, Sunset Hills, Centreville, Washington Park, Dupo, Madison, Lakeshire, Lemay, Mehlville, Affton, Cahokia Parks Airport, Oakville, Fairmont City, Green Park and Alorton.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
